content.description: This beautiful crack system is the most obvious line on the wall. The start of the climb is marked by two bolts that protect 2 boulder problems onto ledges. The climb is well protected and definitely worth getting on if you are in the area. If this climb was off the side of the road on Lemmon there would be a line to get on it.
content.protection: Doubles from red c3 up to #3. One number four is useful for the top but not necessary, offset nuts are nice to have.
content.location: The crack is the most obvious right leaning system on the wall, it continues all the way up to the two bolt rap anchor.Â

content.description: Elsie the Cow features a beautiful North facing wall with a handful a beautiful cracks. Chances are you won't be waiting in line to get on the classic Rollins Route. Even though this serene wall is only a three minute walk from Warpaint it seems to have gone overlooked. The granite is quite clean save for some lichen/moss down low. The summit of this dome does bear a resemblance to the "famous bovine" Elsie, also kinda looks like a dragon.
